instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message:
hi, this board came in with mild liquid damage around <CHIP>U5510</CHIP>.
its quarter fan spinning.
even after clean and replace <CHIP>U5510</CHIP> still quarter spinning.
then with thermal cam i found that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
removing <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> relieve the short.
anyone have the bios clean file for this board ? can't seem to find the file on other forum without paying for membership..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> should works in this case.
Try this file, as is.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jcyRJrjPYBIVhrVxQDba06omBoAU1anm/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Here is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> file, no clean!
I didn't have time to clean it; can do it yourself, with Medusa, or UEFITool and Intel FIT.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ODJKQo7YLje9NFkYo_iiTVokYbzqoRKO/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message:
i tried first file,  its not quarter fan spinning anymore, but still no usb activity.
i tried the second file, and clean me with medusa. its not quarter fan spinning, but i get fan spin that start normal, and later will blow faster.
no usb activity,  i got 1.1v at <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>..
my brain just shut off wanting to point out pch or ram problem on this 2011 macbook haha

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message:
Fan will spin faster if you test the board alone on the desk.
Trackpad is required, as it has some temp sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message:
ok.. but still no usb activity, so i dont need trackpad too test right..
i tried to reflow each ram, but still no avail..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message: Beeps RAM error code, if connect the onboard speaker and LIO board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> shorted.
threads.message: theres no beeping sound, i use the charging port + the cable bridge too.
